intro: Biscutella laevigata var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its glabrous (smooth) stems and leaves, which are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring. This species is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
